summary: American Express responds to an FBI subpoena in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, providing electronic documents including statements, payments, correspondence, notes, IP addresses, and declaration instructions. The response indicates some documents may not be provided due to lack of activity, inability to locate, record retention issues, or pending delivery from third parties.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named in the case reference for which the subpoena was issued, indicating her credit card records are being sought.

events.title: American Express Subpoena Response
events.description: American Express sends electronic documents to the FBI in response to a grand jury subpoena in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

locations: American Express Attn: Subpoena Response Unit 03 Butterfield Circle El Paso, Tx 79906
FBI 26 Federal Plaza New York, NY 10278
keyFacts: American Express provided documents including statements, payments, correspondence, notes, IP addresses, and declaration instructions in response to an FBI subpoena.
The subpoena is related to Grand Jury case number 2019R01188 targeting Ghislaine Maxwell.
Some documents were not provided due to no activity during certain months, inability to locate, record retention periods, or pending third-party delivery.
The electronic files are encrypted for 'Read and Print only' with a password sent separately.
The response indicates ongoing investigation into financial records and communications linked to Maxwell.
